line_1: All, all will vanish, while his priests applaud,
line_2: And saint the perjurer for the pious fraud.

line_1: Yet never pleas'd but when the fools applaud:
line_2: Disdaining by the vulgar to be aw'd,

line_1: With mingling cries dispersing hosts applaud,
line_2: And shouting nations own THE LIVING GOD."

line_1: — Pleased Fawns and Nymphs with dancing step applaud,
line_2: And hang their chaplets round the resting God;

line_1: Or vainly think I would thy Choice applaud,
line_2: Tho' I did yield to a fond Mothers Fraud;

line_1: Like England only, and its Taste applaud.
line_2: But honest men who never were abroad,

line_1: With Double Joy we shout, and twice applaud
line_2: Councils at Home and Conquest from Abroad.

line_1: How formal fools the farce of state applaud;
line_2: How caution watches at the lips of fraud;

line_1: The world will still the noble act applaud,
line_2: Tho' victory was gain'd by needful fraud.
